title: Spain 2019
review: I stayed at this hotel for 1 week, room was very spacious, and clean.  Bathroom was compact, vent held in place with masking tape, tiles were grubby (water scale)  and the cutting for the fitment of the taps etc was so bad, not even grouted up - looked like a diy-er had done the tiling.  First 2 mornings room was cleaned as you would expect, pjs folded , glasses washed, after that bed just made and bin half emptied. Attitude of staff so arrogant- one day at 5 am and enquired if I could have some breakfast to take out , told “no” rather abruptly, no sorry we can’t do that, just no!  Majority of the fruits at breakfast were so overripe (apples all wrinkly, bananas all black) only good for baking.  Vending machine for hot drinks - water wasn’t hot enough to make tea, being a Brit, I like a cup of tea.  Had a meal in the bar/cafeteria one evening and had to wait almost 30 minutes, apart from that the service was good and food hot.  No literature in room about the area, and no literature available in English  Hotel was not busy, but any questions had to wait at least 10 mins at reception to be acknowledged…

title: Mr Andrew skinner
review: perfect hotel the staff are brilliant the position is ideal bus and trams right on the doorstep hotel is spotless and great value we will definitely be back food in the hotel is very good also bars and restaurants are nearby

title: Anniversary
review: Dear Customer; Thank you for your comment, we suggest you enjoy our Superior and Premium rooms during your next visit. They will like it !! regards

title: Relaxing hotel...
review: Spent 6 day city break last week, thoroughly enjoyed it, rooms were clean we had all our requests met, high floor and quiet room. Food was nice enough, as expected after reading reviews although didn't try cooked breakfasts as continental was enough.  Bus stopped outside as well as tram which was two minutes away to take you to Alicante or 5 minute walk to catch tram to El Campello and change to to Benidorm Only down side was weather wind and rain

title: Second visit - we love this hotel!
review: Had booked 1 night but ended staying for 3 nights once we got the lay of the town very close to beach less than 5 mins and the promenade is ideal for a long walk. Hotel is clean and reception staff very accommodating and helpful bar area clean and drinks not so expensive...

title: Week in Alicante
review: The Hotel Castilla is in the San Juan Playa area . This we found was a rather quite area with a good beach and a long promenade . The Hotel itself was very clean  .We booked on a full board basis which we regretted . The reason was we found the Breakfast very basic . Not much choice . The lunch and dinner were three course meals selected from a menu . Again very poor choice. The meals were made worse by the restuarant staff who were really miserable , a complete contrast to the cleaning and reception staff who were great . This made meal times hard to tolerate . Eventually to the point where we ate out on many occasions . There are  plenty of places to eat in Alicante City .  We went via Tram quite often down to Alicante City . The Trams run every half hour down to either…

title: Brilliant value for money, near the beach
review: Thanks for your comments, it is very important for other clients to read about the establishment they want to stay.  We greatly regret that we did not help you with your inconvenience in the restaurant, we would have liked to known it at the moment it happened to find a solution in real time.  Sorry for the inconvenience and we hope to see you again.  Enjoy the Summer  Kind regards

title: Enjoyable Stay
review: Just spent four days in the Castilla. Surprisingly great hotel. Room excellent , recently refurbished to top standard. Unbelievably comfortable bed. Lovely swimming pool and lounger area. Tapas were all delicious as were the Gin & tonics. House wines fantastic. Front of house staff super helpful particularly Jose. Bus right outside into Alicante 21& 22. Tram stop not too far away either. Food looked excellent from the restaurant.  We will be back for sure.  Try Boca de Mar restaurant about 100m from the hotel - superb food from friendly people

title: Good facilities in a great position close to beach
review: We had three nights at this very nice hotel and generally enjoyed it very much. It does have one or two niggles but also many things going for it and we would consider a return visit.   Location – very good indeed.   You are a two minute walk to the wonderful and very long beach. This has a beautiful promenade and its full length is about 2 miles. There are lots of restaurants along the front and sun loungers available for hire at about €15 for two with a parasol.   The centre of Alicante is 8 km away and this takes about half an hour by public transport. The hotel is very well served in this direction with the bus stop immediately opposite and the tram around four minutes walk away. Both modes of transport are clean and very cheap.  Rooms – like many hotels in Spain they are…

title: Fabulous hotel and staff
review: Dear customer;  I appreciate your opinion, it is very important for us and our customers. We wish to have the pleasure of welcoming you again.  Sincerely,

title: 2nd Time Here
review: We had a great time 2 years ago so this year we thought we would visit Castilla again.Clean hotel,staff friendly and engaging.The breakfast isn't the best,but it suited me and my boyf as we spent the rest of the day out and about.Take a travel kettle if you can with you as the hotel doesn't provide this.Great place if you want to have a day by the pool,relax and not spend too much time in the hotel.Somewhere to crash and then make the most of your day..cannot rate the cleanliness enough of the hotel so clean!👍 They upgraded our room as well because we asked for double but got 2 singles,bed is extremely comfy.Met a lovely couple from Burnley ☺

title: Great for Beach and Tram
review: Dear Customer;  Thank you for your comment, we suggest you enjoy our Superior and Premium rooms during your next visit.   They will like it !!   Best regards

title: Decent value and well located
review: We live about 100 miles south of this hotel and popped up for a long weekend break. The room was on the top floor, it was clean and modern, comfortable bed and very large terrace. it could have had a couple of extra electric sockets instead of just one each side of built in headrest cum shelf unit. A bedside table or init at the side of the bed would have been useful instead of having to put things on the floor or struggle to put them above on a shelf.Breakfast was OK, scrambled eggs and some bacon were the cooked items and the usual cold meats and cheese. We went out of season and there were still queues for the toaster and coffee machines, I would think there would be a long wait in summer. Although we were 8 floors up we did suffer from late night noise from a bar/restaurant…

title: Great value with beach location but make sure you go on season!
review: Dear customer;  We have received various comments from you.   I appreciate your opinion, it is very important for us and our customers.   We wish to have the pleasure of welcoming you again.  Sincerely

title: A hotel we love
review: Hotel good value.  Excellent location near the beach.  Breakfast a bit dismal, lady working there from 7:30 am till 10pm, I’m not sure that’s correct in the free world, especially in Europe, no wonder she was a bit grumpy. Hope she got a break.  Reception very polite and helpful. Now, the restaurant is an issue, I hope they did not pay for its design, otherwise it’s a real shame. Clinical lights flooding the sparsely white plastic furnished room, white walls give you a feeling you should be in the operating room. The automatic doors opening wide, letting the cold air invade the entire restaurant, would be perfect for a stretcher to pass through, really, who design this space? The food is not remarkable either.  Nice pool to catch a few rays.

title: Great value out of season; excellent location for quiet beach holiday
review: Got a good deal on rooms (I think you may get even better direct via the hotel website, but I couldn't make it work successfully so resorted to using a booking dot com company).  Eating out in the local area was cheap, with plenty of options to choose from; there's a local supermarket about 1/4 of a mile away, with local bakeries even closer, so we shopped there for breakfast things and snacks.  Rooms very clean and comfortable without frills.  Take a travel kettle and mugs if you like a cuppa; as with most continental hotels a kettle isn't standard in the room.  A fridge would be a  very welcome addition, but that's the only thing really that it was lacking. It's a bit 'city block' in terms of views and outlook, as this is an area highly focussed on tourism, however, the area…

title: Very clean
review: Clean modern hotel. Good condition rooms, lovely crisp bedding and modern bathrooms. No kettle or bizarrely I could not even borrow an iron for my clothes,  a first in all my hotel stays. So don't stay for business unless you want to look a creased wreck. Breakfast was basic and soon ran out of items when I asked for replenishment was told there was none. So a basic clean stay, hence 3/5.

title: Feels like home.
review: Dear Customer;  Please forgive us if there was a product that did not have replacement but we usually replenish everything.  Comentarle that we can not leave an iron, if it was an accident the error is ours. We have laundry and ironing service.  Thanks to your comments, you are always welcome to improve day by day.  Regards

title: Booked by easyJet due to snow at Bristol
review: Thank you once again to all the wonderful staff at the Castilla. My wife and myself have always loved this hotel. Thanks to Alfonso and all the hardworking restaurant staff, housekeeping ladies wonderful and reception staff very professional. Special mention to Jackie who always makes us welcome lovely lady.

title: Stayed due to canx flight
review: Excellent location, a short walk from the lovely flat long promenade. Extremely pleasant and helpful lady, Celia at reception, as was Alejandro at the bar, very friendly. Rooms and bathroom extremely clean and comfortable. Waitressing staff at Dinner were abrupt, miserable, and telling clients where to sit, in a dreadful manner. This was spotted by a grey suited lady, who after speaking to the staff, they were more “pleasant” to the customers. It seemed that they only wanted people sat at the least numbers of tables. Breakfast staff, and the continental breakfast were excellent. Would stay here again, but would not be inclined to dine in.

title: Lack of Management
review: We booked double room ( not twin ) one month ago , we inform Hotel about choice of the bed same day as booking, one day before arrival we receive a message that hotel cannot guarantee double room with one bed  ???? We have long discussion at check in and receive stupid excuses from receptionist about why we cannot have what we had ordered....  anyway at the end we got double room ... Manager of this place should be ashamed about his lack of organize a rooms for the  guest . There is never bad hotel its only BAD MANAGEMENT !

title: Clive
review: Dear customer:  We want to apologize because the receptionist who attended you on arrival did not know that we had changed the bed, as we indicated you a day before your arrival. We always try to do everything possible to meet all requests, although sometimes it is not possible to reach them all.  But effectively, as you specified in your request, the room had a double bed since your arrival at the hotel.  Thanks for your comments.

title: Out of season very central for local public transport and San Juan beech.
review: Stayed for four nights over Christmas, room spotless, cleaned everyday and fresh towels daily. Staff all friendly and helpful. Enjoyed continental breakfast and evening meals Christmas Day special dinner was excellent. Will be booking for next year, many thanks to all the staff that made our stay welcome

title: Good well located accommodation
review: Dear guests;  Thanks you for choosing us, we have received several congratulations regarding the Christmas lunch.  Thank you very much for your company and we wish you a happy new year.  We hope to see you back soon.  Ana Sarmiento

title: Perfect
review: Mid November can be wet windy and cold, we had four very warm sunny days. Hotel is one street over from seven mile sandy beech and long promenade. Bus and tram stops a short walk away. From airport Bus C6 at no7 stop to board L4 tram to Playa San Juan/ Pl,La,Coruna. On half board we first lunched at sea front Burgerking, after which we bought large apples for lunch. The hotel room was a little tired but clean and comfortable with four English tv channels. The receptionists spoke excellent English and eager to help. Continental breakfast could be increased to full English for 3 euros. Evening meals were set three course, changed daily, served to your table. A choice of two starters, Main meal also a two choice usually fish or meat, but vegetarian available and puddings. WE WERE…

title: Fantastic
review: Jose was the most friendly and helpful concierge. Very patient and a good laugh. The hotel was lovely, clean, close to the beach and other bars and restaurants. Perfect for our long weekend away with a group of girls. Would definitely go back!

title: Conveniently located for beach and public transport.
review: Small room but proper king-sized bed; excellant bedside reading lights; balcony (side views); good wi-fi and TV (4 English channels); good breakfast buffet; close to bus and tram stops.  Some staff very polite and helpful. BUT no tea or coffee making facilities in room! (Queried this in advance and were told hot water always available from the bar. Yes but not told there would be a charge). Only one easy chair in the double room (plus one wooden desk chair) so uncomfortable for one. No tissues in bathroom; no TV channel listing in room. Worst of all during the 3 (of 7 ) nights, strong winds caused very noisey irregular metallic clanging from the ventilation shaft ( ? ). So sleep was impossible for much of the time. Change of room offered but could not be sure it would be any…

title: Reception
review: Just back from Castilla Alicante, stayed there for 4 nights. The reception staff were fantastic, in particular Jose, nothing was a problem to them. The staff in the cafe bar were all very polite and welcoming. As for the restaurant staff, rather grumpy attitude at evening meal time. Whether they were unsure of English speaking customers, maybe that was why they looked so grumpy. The meal selection.. 2 choices for each course none of which were fabulous. The cleaning staff were fantastic, rooms cleaned every day to a high standard, very cheerful staff. The resort itself was very quiet, maybe as it was nearing the end of season, there were very few shops there and hardly any restaurants still open.  The beach was wonderful, it stretches for miles, clean, golden sand. Easy access…

title: Enjoyable stay
review: This is a good average 3 star hotel. Comfortable beds, all areas kept very clean and an adequate breakfast. San Juan beach is a couple of minutes walk and the bus stop is outside on main road 21 and 22 takes you into Alicante.

title: Lovely time
review: Just back from a mini break. Very well situated hotel, took C6 airport bus then tram line 4 which stops 5 mins from hotel. Also frequent bus service Nos22 and 21.  Hotel is older but spotless, lovely fresh smell when u enter reception, rooms were ready when we arrived at 1pm. We booked a standard room which was large, clean with a shower and bath, the furniture was more traditional ie dark wood but was fine and I can be fussy. Didn’t think I’d see the sea in a standard room but we did plus a view of the pool with afternoon sun on the balcony. All the staff were really nice and we enjoyed waitress service at dinner , made a nice change from having to jump up and down to a buffet table.  Shops, supermarkets etc close by. Lovely wide prom and fantastic beach. Found a lovely beach…

title: Lovely hotel
review: Stayed here with my friend for 5 nights. Would definitely recommend.  2 min walk to a lovely beach , shops and bars around, nearby tram. Lovely shop that sells everything just across the road. Pool very cold , would be nice if heated.  Staff in hotel very pleasant. Especially Pablo in restaurant who served us coffee every morning and Jose from reception who we met on our last day but was a really lovely man.  Beds were made everyday and again, staff very pleasant.  Will return to this little gem for sure. Thank you for a lovely stay.

title: Good hotel one block from beach
review: Very good choice out of season, with a value rate.  Spacious room and balcony.  Arrived at midday and happy to check us in early: on departure, we could use pool are and other facilities after checkout for rest of the day (as we had a late flight).  Great (and unusual in Spain) to have pool available in mid-October.  Cafe-bar with terrace good for evening drinks etc.  Varied breakfast choices and good value at 7 when booked with the room.  Didn't eat in the restaurant as the menu did not look too exciting but lots of other dining options within a short walk.  Free street parking, although the hotel has its own, with a fee.

title: Extremely clean
review: Very disapointing to have no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Even though I paid €140 to upgrade to superior double I was told by reception it is Not Possible to hire a kettle. We were told to buy coffee in the bar, which was €2.35 each for the smallest cup.  Breakfast ok, if you like continental. Restaurant lunch/dinner ok but very small portions, but price only €15 each

title: Relaxing stay
review: Dear customer:  Thank you for your comment, we understand that your services were in full pension to have that price of € 140 indicated. In our services we do not have tea / coffee in the room and cafeteria prices are very cheap 1.50 € coffee with milk.  Thanks again for your trust and your comments.  Cordialment

title: Some highs some lows
review: Stayed in a superior room as we wanted a walk in shower. The bathroom has a hairdryer and toiletries provided ( they were replenished daily) bedroom was a good size and maid service daily was immaculately cleaned. The tv is very good has quite a few U.K. channels ITV&ITV2 . Paid extra for a fridge €8 per day but made good use of it! There is a safe in room but that is extra too. Balcony is a good size , our room had a side sea view. Pool area was fantastic ! Very spacious Clean pool and plenty of loungers available any time of day when we stayed. Breakfast is okay would sometimes seem chaotic when you walked in to be seated but was always greeted swiftly and there was always plenty of room. lots of continental options, fruit , cereals , yoghurts cheeses and pastries. There was…

title: Lovely hotel. Perfect location
review: Stayed for five days and everything was perfect. Very relaxed and calm atmosphere. Room bright and clean, the maids did a good job. Breakfast had everything you need to start the day. Location is the best, just 2 min walk from beautiful San Juan beach. One tip..there is a button on the tv remote that change the audio on english programs that are dubbed with spanish.

title: Nice hotel in very good position!!
review: The hotel was nice and in a very good position next to beach, restaurants, shops! What i did't like was that they don't have a minibar in the room and the cleanliness of the room when we arrived! The toilet  wasn' t clean . I cleaned it myself.   The breakfast was more than a continental , they have one kind of sausages, some bacon and scrambled eggs but no vegetables ! They had only some mashed tomatoes (raw) for bruschette maybe and when i asked for a hole tomato they said it cannot be because this is a continental !   Beach towels costs 2€ each and if you want to change it , it will cost you 2 € every time.  The staff was helpfull ! I would stay here again but without breakfast included!!

title: Beautiful beach and wonderful hotel
review: We fell in love with San Juan from the minute we arrived.  Hotel staff were really friendly and helpful.  Miles of golden sand just a few minutes away.  We thought the breakfast was very good, lots of choice and everything displayed nicely.  Yes, there is no fridge but you can rent one if you need it or upgrade you room.  Alicante is really easy to get to on the tram and a very kind Spanish man helped us work out the ticket machine. Alicante is gorgeous and very interesting - lots of museums , fantastic architecture and nice shops.  Two places nearby are worth a visit - just turn left out of the hotel  and a minutes walk away is the LOs Palmeros Lounge which does really  good food and has very accommodating staff.  Also, next door is the Oasis cafe which also has wonderful food…

title: Lovely staff
review: Dear customer;  I appreciate your opinion, it is very important for us and our customers. We wish to have the pleasure of welcoming you again.  Sincerely,

title: Lovely sunrise in the Mediterranean Sea
review: Had a great time at san juan beach was great its very quiet in the evening .tram was a 5 minute walk away to alicante city which took 30 minutes Now for the hotel which was very clean staff were lovely and friendly and accomadating it was 2 mins away from the lovely beach the only dissapointing thing was the food in tge restaurant it was awful and i can eat anything so we had to pay for our evening meal in the separate cafe area which was cheap enough and lovely but not goid as we had paid half board

title: Nice hotel in nice part of Alicante.
review: My wife and i booked this hotel because we didn't want to be in central Alicante and we didn't want to stay in any of the main resorts like Benidorm etc. Turned out to be a pretty good choice, the area is what i would call quite traditional and you might need to have a phrase book handy or google translate at least as there's very little english spoken. The hotel is very nice and is spotless as is the pool area. They're always cleaning and the staff are very attentive.  The hotel is easy enough to reach on public transport from the airport if you do your research beforehand. C6 bus from the airport to central Alicante and then either the 21 to 22 bus or even better is the tram L4. Only thing i would say about the hotel is that it can be quite noisy a night and in the early hours…

title: Great hotel
review: Dear Sir,  Thank you for your comments on your recent stay in our hotel, it is very important for other customers to know your explanations. Your feedback  explains the area very well and clear.  We take note of the breakfast and we have been talking with the management, at the end of the week we will change it to a full breakfast buffet with a lot more variety.  Thanks again  Ana Sarmiento

title: Big room, good value for money but noisy
review: Just got back from a five day break, the hotel is spotless and the cleaners do a fantastic job. All the staff was friendly and very accommodating. The food wasn’t great with a choice of two meals and breakfast basic. On the plus side though there is a lovely cafe inside the hotel where we ate most days. The beach is just a few minutes down the road with clean sand and clear water. The pool is clean with comfy sun beds.

title: Short break
review: We stayed at the hotel for a long weekend while competing at the European Masters athletics championships. The location was perfect being walking distance to the beach and to the start/finish of several of the races as well as having good bus and tram links into the centre of town. The room was extremely large and very good value for money, the only negatives were that it was quite cold in the room overnight (even with a blanket) and there is no sound proofing so we slept badly - at one point it seemed as though someone was using a masonry drill to put holes in the wall at 2am! One other (minor) quibble is that we were charged 2 euros a day to use the safe in the room.

title: For Beach Lovers
review: Great hotel, great location, easily accessible to the beach and tram stop and buses for travelling into the main centre. Upon a request for a top floor room prior to our arrival the hotel was happy to accomodate such a request. Hotel spotlessly clean. Cleaning staff very friendly as were reception staff. Great value for money..would not stay anywhere else were we to visit again. One minor detail, kettle in room would be nice for that good old english cup of tea...great value for money. Thank you hotel castilla.x

title: Golf trip with friends
review: Perfect location for any type of holiday...shopping, sun, beach, golf. Half an hour bus journey to city centre (€1.45) - stop outside the door. Most helpful reception staff, all problems treated efficiently and with a smile. No comparison between Spanish and Irish prices - for everything! Thank you for caring attention

title: Repeat visit
review: Dear customer,   Thank you for dedicating your time.  We hope to see you soon.  Ana Sarmiento

title: Good hotel
review: Repeat visit for us, the Castilla is a great,clean hotel situated near the beach. Breakfast basic but adequate. Bar prices ridiculously cheap E1.30 for a coffee and E6.00 for a bottle of wine! Ate at the hotel and was deeply disapointed on 2 occasions - very poor food,served cold and burnt. Would return again for the comfort and cleanliness and ease of getting to hotel - bus stop outside. We stayed in March and most local restaurants shut. San Juan is a very peaceful resort with a lovely,clean beach.

title: Winter sun break
review: Dear Customer,  We feel sorry about the food was not to your liking. I transfer your discomfort to the cook and we hope very sincerely that these incidents will not be repeated.  Greetings and thank you for your comments.  Ana Sarmiento

title: Very good location
review: Hotel very clean, rooms cleaned daily, clean towels, shower gels, shampoo provided. Excellent position 5 minutes walk to seafront. Breakfast is continental, not good if you like typical English breakfast of bacon, eggs and beans. Very quiet at this time of year, most shops and cafes shut. Also brush up on your Spanish as not a lot of English spoken. We found it difficult to find decent food and if you can find it, it’s very expensive.

title: Fantastic
review: Great location beach 5 mins walk away. Restaurants Bars 5 mins walk away and yet a lovely quiet hotel with swimming pool which was cleaned every day. Good restaurant on site to. Lovely clean rooms well kept Hotel

title: Not Peaceful Holiday
review: First day arriving the bar staff twice spoke to me in disgusting manner, actually snapping at me ?,when I tried to talk to them. Spent all my time and money outside hotel because of this. Reception (some ) seemed unhappy and unfriendly. Room at front of hotel, noise was unbelievable, trams, buses driving past every 20 minutes, at night cars and motorbikes with noisy exhausts driving past until early hours am. Hotel held wedding parties through weekend, people screaming and shouting till 4 am. Cleaning staff very good and efficient at their job.  If you want nice peaceful holiday, stay away.

title: Great holiday location
review: Dear client, We are awfully that our hotel was not what you expected.  We will study all the negative points you indicated in order to avoid these kind of problems with other travellers. Kind Regards

title: Very relaxing
review: We stayed at the hotel during the Volvo Ocean Race weekend, so the hotel was quite full. I had requested a room with a view of the sea, and we got exactly what I had asked for, with the bonus of being on the top floor. The room had a nice balcony as well. The elevators ran quickly. We liked the shower, which was stall-style in the footprint of a tub. The hotel is about a block and a half from the beach, and 2 blocks from a tram stop, with the ride to the center of Alicante taking maybe 30 minutes. The staff was friendly and helpful, and their English was much better than my Spanish.. We bought the B&B package, and the breakfast was about average. There were plenty of restaurants and bars within an easy walk of the hotel.

title: If you enjoy mediocre stay here
review: Dear client, Thank you for your nice review. We are pleased to check that your stay with us was satisfactory. Kind Regards

title: Perfect location
review: We booked a deluxe room at a good rate that included breakfast. We were on the 5th floor with views(between the buildings) of the sea which is about 5 minutes walk.  The hotel is perfectly located with tram line and buses on main road if required.Plenty of restaurants along beach and inland,lots of choice and some really nice bars dotted around. The room itself was spotless and good quality toiletries provided with more added daily if needed. The breakfast had lots of choice,yoghurts,fruit,cereal,different teas,coffee,pastries,meats,egg and bacon.It also had a small selection of gluten free cakes/biscuits. I would say that the quality of the breakfast overall was questionable for example eggs flavourless,bacon mainly consisted of fat.Cereal cheap quality,however considering the…

title: unexpected menus.
review: Dear client, Thank you for taking your time and writing some lines regarding our hotel and the surroundings. We take note of your reccomendations regarding the breakfast  and we will try to do our best in order to improve it.  Kind Regards

title: Poor quality
review: Stayed at this hotel end of september to October.We found on our arrival in the early hours of the morning greeted by a very pleasant receptionist but was not given the full information of the local amenities.as we found later other guests were supplied with a local map bus times and tram stops.We wandered about the resort searching for information and felt quiet lost as this area is mostly spanish speaking.We also found a lot of the information offices had closed down for the end of the season and various shops and restaurants had closed down. which was very disappointing.Fantastic beaches and great weather made our holiday.Before i finish i will mention the hotel was very clean.We booked half board for breakfast and evening meals.Breakfast was cereals bread and scrambled egg…

title: Very pleasant stay
review: Dear client,  We are so sorry that you did not enjoyed your stay with us. We will learn from your review so that we can avoid problems of this kind in the future. We apologize once again.  Kind Regards

title: Short break. Would go back again
review: Glad we didn’t get full board. The breakfast was very poor quality and not much choice , waitress quite rude. The rooms old and not well kept. You could hear everything from room to room. We’re usually easy , but this time I wouldn’t recommend this place to any of my friends.

title: Ten Day Stay In September
review: Six us stayed in 3 twin rooms for our ten day stay for a friend's 50th birthday get away. The hotel was fairly spotless, the staff were always friendly, polite and helpful, the facilities were suitable and the location was within easy reach of bars, shops and the beach. Although this was counted as "off peak" we had temperatures around 30 degrees for most of our stay. There are bus stops just yards from the front door and tram stops a few hundred yards round the corner, where you could set off to Alicante City or Benidorm, with ease. The area is a bit more of a Spanish influence rather than suited to holidaying Brits, so familiarising yourself with all the basic phrases would be a bonus. After all, if you are abroad, why should everybody else speak English? ;-)  The rooms have…

title: Attention to detail, improvement needed
review: Dear Customer ;  We are happy to know that you have enjoyed your vacation.  Thanks for your comments .  We hope to see you again.  Regards

title: Vacances San Juan
review: Booked this hotel several months before traveling and arranged a late checkout before booking flights, hotel confirmed we could have a late checkout so proceeded to book late night return flights in order to enjoy a full last day in resort. I also requested a double bed in our room of which was also confirmed by the hotel prior to departing, we were also arriving in resort early morning so requested an early check in. All of the above requests were accepted by the hotel along with being advised of the respective additional costs.  Upon arrival on our first day we were told our room would not be ready until between 2-4pm but could change our clothes in the toilet of we wished, not a good start but we did change to more casual clothes and went out for the day and spent some time…

title: Could not have asked for more
review: Nice hotel,  can be reached easily from airport by public transport  (like 40 minutes ) Upon arrival we were welcomed happily and as we came earlier they kept our luggage while we could enjoy the beach.  At the Reception we had all information about tram / bus / local map  The room was clean and had all the necessity for a good shower and rest after long day at the beach.  Talking about the beach,  very sandy beach of 3.5km long with loads of bistros and pubs to grab a bite.  Breakfast at hotel is very good. Open buffet with Bread,  fruits, coffee, tea, juices,  Spanish cakes and salami and bacon&eggs . Decent view from room balcony. Overall the hotel deserves the 3 star and we would recommend this hotel.

title: Good choice close to the beach
review: Dear Customer ;  Thanks for your comments and for recommending us to other guests it is very important for us your opinion for which we thank you again.  Regards Ana Sarmiento

title: Lovely 7 day break, just one issue
review: Went to this hotel for one weeks break in the sun. We love the location (Playa San Juan), beautiful beach and lots of eating out choices. Be aware this is a Spanish tourist area so there are no English, Dutch or German bars which suits us fine! The hotel guests are also mainly Spanish however the reception staff have good English and are very helpful. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the pool and sunbeds are hardly used, only one family tried to reserve beds (North Europeans, you can guess the country). Staff here are very friendly and rooms are very clean & nice. When I return to Alicante I will certainly be returning to this hotel.

title: Great 3 star Hotel
review: Dear client,  We are really happy to see that you enjoyed your stay with us . We always try to do our best so that our clients feel like home. We will keep working in order to do it even better.  Thank you for your opinion. We hope to see you soon.  Ana Sarmiento

title: Flight canelled, extra few days holiday!
review: We really enjoyed our stay here.The hotel is in a great location and is clean and modern with nice large bedrooms and a decent size balcony.We only ate here at breakfast as there are many restaurants locally or an easy tram ride into Alicante city.We had a nice beach view and a lovely spacious terrace we also found all the staff very friendly.I would come to this hotel again if i am ever in this area.

title: Holiday
review: Dear client,  Thank you for sharing your opinion regarding our hotel and San Juan beach with other travelers. It could be very useful for them. We are content to know that you enjoyed your holiday here.    We hope to see you soon.    Ana Sarmiento

title: Unpleasant hidden extras
review: We ended up here not by choice , but rather due to the French Air Traffic Controllers going on strike and our Ryanair flight being cancelled! We got here very tiered and depesperate for bed at 0430, after a day trying to get home! The receptionist at that time of night was very quick and efficient even having to take all out details and photocopy all out passports, there was about 40+ on our bus from the airport luckily we were first off the bus so can say how long others had to wait, but the lady was as quick as she could be. We were given adjoining rooms which was good for us as made sorting stuff out easier, the rooms had no fridges or cooking facility's but did have hairdriers in the bathroom. we had breakfast there which was fine, the bar served to order pizzas etc later in…

title: still here
review: Unhappy with evening food have let it go untill now but will have to speak to someone in the morning, had to send food away but with two more days to go might have to eat out and try for a refund for to days meals.

title: Perfect location for a City or Beach holiday
review: Dear client, We are sorry to hear that dinner was not what you expected. We will keep working in order to improve the services we offer to our clients. Thank you.

title: Great value hotel
review: We have stayed at this hotel twice now (both off season) and we love it. I have mobility problems but everything was so accessible and the hotel staff helped with any request. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. It is only a 2 min walk to the lovely sandy beach of San Juan. Lovely palm trees and lovely authentic Spanish restaurants. The hotel also has a lunch/dinner menu if you felt like staying in for only E12.50 (includes 3 courses). This area does not have the 'Benidorm tourist' feel which is a welcome change. Some restaurants have ''menu ingles' if you ask but you quickly learn what the Spanish words are especially if you are used to ordering tapas.  If you want to escape the beach, you can be in the city centre of Alicante in 20mins either by tram (stop Londres 2 min…

title: Very nice hotel with good access to Alicante city.
review: Dear client, Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with other clients. We will keep working to make our clients stay as comfortable as possible. We hope to see you soon.   Thank you.

title: perfect hotel, poor food
review: A good looking, well maintained1960s hotel, one block from the beach. Easy parking outside. Friendly reception staff. We stayed on the seventh floor. The on suite room is typical of holiday hotels, king size bed, ample storage, balcony and good sized bathroom with plenty of hot water. This hotel is great value for the money.

title: Great value for the money
review: A busy hotel with hundreds of guests on holiday. You notice that at breakfast time. Apart from that, clean, friendly, with staff willing to help you. The room was large and clean, with a large balcony with a table and two chairs. We could see the sea between two huge buildings, but San Juan is not exactely a desert Island. Parking for a small fee. Altogether a very agreeable stay with nothing to complain about.

title: value for money
review: Dear Customer:  Thank you for your comments are very positive and we are grateful. The satisfaction of our customers are only nustros interest. Thank you .  Regards .  Ana Sarmiento

title: Fantastic placement and good service
review: staff are friendly and helpful, rooms were a good size for 2, good decor and always clean. the WIFI is free and no complaints with the signal strength in the room.  breakfast was ok (continental type). the pool area was ok but had to move about or you ended in the shade the pool opens at 10.30am so no problem with people leaving towels on sunbeds in any case the pool area was never crowded plenty of parking spaces nearby if you were lucky you could park at the front door.about 100m from a tram stop (Londres) which was great for going into Alicante and easier than taking the car, cheap as well. the local area has bars and restaurants of which there is a good choice most of the other holiday makers are Spanish and you actually feel like you are abroad, nothing like benidorm etc.…

title: Disappointed
review: Dear Customer:  Thank you for your comments.  With customer feedback know the beach area of San Juan perfectly and our establishment perfectly. Thank you .  We hope to see you again,  Regards .  Ana Sarmiento

title: Excellent Hotel and surrounding areas
review: W visited this hotel in the off season just after the tourists went back to Work.   The Hotel is clean and has a good service level. The staff is polite and helpfull, but be sure to brush up on your spanish because only a few speak English.  The restaurant is good and so is the breakfast.  The placement of the hotel is fantastic - 2 minutes to the Beach. This makes fantastic morning trips running along the Beach in the sunrise possible. I imagine that the main road could generate some noise during the tourist season.  There are restaurants nearby so you need not fear going to bed hungry.

title: Quite basic but very nice hotel
review: Our first visit to this hotel, it is quite basic but very nice & modern the quirky art work & furnishings very nice!  The hotel is kept spotlessly clean and our room was cleaned beautifully  every day and smelt so nice and fresh when returned after breakfast. The staff are very friendly & helpful but many don't speak a lot of English so if you can speak a bit of Spanish it helps! But don't worry you will get by! I think they just appreciate it if you try to use a few words of Spanish - on that note ,  the area of San Juan is populated mainly by Spanish people  unlike places like Benidorm, and again knowing a bit of the language will help you .   As with most of the costa blanca restaurants did not seem to start serving much before 8.30-9pm most nights and at the time we went…

title: A Lovely pool and simple room
review: Dear client,  Thank you for having taken the time  to share your opinion. It will help other travelers.   We are really happy for having met your expectations and we hope to see you soon.  Regards.  Ana Sarmiento

title: Good hotel near the beach
review: We decided to leave our apartment in Alicante town and head to san juan beach to get a different feel, and decided to stay at the Hotel Castilla.  I love to swim everyday and Hotel Castilla has a great pool to swim in. The room we had was spacious, quiet and comfortable, apart from the fact that on the 1st day one of the chambermaids happen to "leave our door OPEN" and we had over £7000 worth of computers in the room. That was very disappointing to us as we use our computers for our life. Having said that the man at reception was very apologetic about the fact and assured me it would never happen again, and it didn't . Thank God!  We travel all over the world so It's important in our eyes to deliver a true message to other travellers of what is good and what is not.  We found…

title: a great budget hotel near the beach
review: Thank you for your review.   First of all, let us apologize once again for the problem regarding your room´s  unlocked door. We assume it was our fault and the management took the appropriate measures so that it does not happen anymore to any other client.  On the other hand , we are sorry your stay was not as pleasant as it should have been  but we keep working to improve the service provided for our 3 stars hotel.  We hope to have the chance to have you with us in another occasion .  Regards Ana Sarmiento

title: Great value hotel
review: We booked this hotel last minute for a few days holiday of relaxing at the beach.  We got a taxi from Alicante airport which cost €35 and took about 20 minutes to get there.  We couldn't check into our rooms until 1:30 so we had a little bit of time to wander and explore the area.  We booked a twin/double bedroom and we ended up being given a larger room with 2 comfy double beds and a view of the pool and sea.  The room was pretty basic but met most of our needs.  There was aircon which was good, a balcony with a table and chairs a TV with a few English channels but most were in Spanish.  The bathroom was nice and big with a really good powerful shower.  Unfortunately there wasn't a mini fridge for us to keep our water in and although there was a safe you had to pay an extra…

title: Enjoyable stay at this lovely hotel.
review: The first thing I have to say about the Hotel Castilla is about the amazing staff. From the moment we arrived and throughout our stay, they were all pleasant, courteous and friendly, in a genuine but understated way. The reception staff speak excellent English and make the effort to be as helpful as possible. It is a Spanish hotel catering mainly (but not exclusively) for Spanish visitors, which we loved. So don't choose this hotel if you like what a typical 'British' Benidorm hotel has to offer because you'll be disappointed. The rooms were spacious and clean, we had a huge balcony with an inland view and sea glimpse. It was very quiet except for the air-con, but it did its job in keeping us cool. Breakfast was included in our deal and there was a great choice, we had scrambled…

title: very close to the beach
review: I recommend this hotel because its location very close to the beach (5 min) and from other means of transport that can take you to the city of Alicante. Like other hotels in Spain, the wifi connection is very bad an you only get password and user name for 3 days in a row. We went in June and the hotel and the entire Playa de San Juan area were 80 percent full of old people.

title: Far from Alicante, but near to the best beach of the zone
review: The hotel is situated right beside the beach in a quiet little village close to Alicante. The rooms are very clean and the wifi works good enough in all the structure. Breakfast is not included and should be payed apart, but many cafè are around the hotel at cheap price. Not suggested for a visit of Alicante buy in a perfect position to enjoy the beach.

title: A pleasant hotel
review: Stayed here for 2 nights recently, room was basic but a nice size and very clean, we had a balcony with a view of the pool and the beach. Hotel is situated within 2 min walk of a lovely beach. Staff are very friendly and helpful, we'd booked bed and breakfast and the continental buffet breakfast was a nice start to the day without being ground breaking. The hotel is a little out of the centre of Alicante so was fairly quiet in the evenings but plenty of cafes, shops, restaurants and bars within easy walking distance. The centre of Alicante is about a 15 euro taxi ride away. Would definitely come back.

title: Absolutely Recommended
review: Hotel Castilla Alicante, to book a room:  For those wanting to know how to book it, this is how it went for me and it was painless. First I sent an email inquiring the room and when they replied with availability, they asked my credit card details so they can charge 25% of the total amount to confirm the booking. As I did not want to send anything via internet, I gave the details by phone and they did the charging of 25% on my credit card while we were still on the phone (!) and by then they confirmed the booking and confirmation was also sent by email. Upon arrival, they checked your passport and signature thoroughly before giving you the room. I am impressed with their tight and securely procedure and I must say it was like that everywhere I went in Spain.  Email address and…

title: Brilliant Short Break
review: My husband and I have just returned from a 4 night break and we stayed at this hotel. I have to say that all staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The hotel in general was very clean and during our stay the reception area was being re-vamped, the end result was stunning. A short walk down to a beautiful beach and the views of the mountains took my breath away. We only ate breakfast in the hotel as we were out and about every day, but the choice was good, including eggs, bacon and sausages for those who like a cooked breakfast, and plenty of choice if you like the continental breakfast.   We used the tram service every day and found it a useful and relaxing way to get about. We found the stop at Londres was the closest to the hotel and it took approximately…

title: Estupendo ! Por que ? 3rd GREAT visit in 12 mnths.....
review: Estimada clienta,  Muchas gracias por su comentario, como bien ,dice estamos mejorando nuestras zonas comunes, cafetería , recepción y restaurante , en breve estará todo terminado.  Espero que en su próxima estancia pueda disfrutar de todo .   Gracias por su confianza .  Saludos

title: These guys are the best
review: Hola buenos dias : I cannot believe that I been to this hotel 3 times in a year ish.... !!!! So, WHY? Well, where do I start..... ?  As usual the hotel stands out due to it cleanliness... Not sure if its me or whether Hotel Castilla spend more time cleaning the hotel than others but...  That's how it seems to me..... so fresh, so clean.... As always the interior is equal to the interior.... Yes, I've said similar before but what make it special to me is that the standard is CONSISTANT !  The same goes with the staff..... All I can really do is to confirm all the very positive things that have already been said... NOT ONLY by me but others......  Playa San Juan ; The Mediterranean sea kisses the ultra soft, clean sandy beaches overlooked by local people taking a walk along the…

title: Perfect location and efficient hotel staff
review: Estimado Cliente ;   Muchas gracias por tu opinión es muy valiosa para nosotros .  Le esperamos el próximo 2016 .  Saludos   Ana Sarmiento

title: Value for money
review: We visited Hotel Castilla Alicante in October for the third time in the last 5 years. Although we knew what to expect, friendly efficient staff, good clean hotel with nice facilities and walking distance to the beach the reception staff really went out of their way to help us. On arrival at about 11PM I had left one piece of luggage, a carry bag in the taxi, and as the taxi sped away I stood at reception explaining to the two gentlemen my predicament, I had no idea who the taxi firm were, no taxi number reg or anything. The reception staff told us not to worry they would sort it out. On coming down to breakfast the following morning we were informed that they had located the taxi and my bag would be returned to the hotel by 12 noon that day, sure enough it was and completely…

title: Don't be put off by the basic interior decor!
review: As other reviewers have said, this hotel does cater mainly for older Spanish guests. But don't be put off - because it's in a perfect location, with clean rooms and great English speaking staff - and superbly low prices! We stayed for 2 nights on the 8th floor (with lift access). Our huge balcony overlooked the main street (great people watching!), had good sea views (lovely sunsets), and looked down over the pool. The inside of the hotel is very dark, and a bit basic - but the rooms are large and clean and comfy. We did have a couple of niggles: the safe didn't work, breakfast was very basic, and there weren't any extra pillows - but these were more than made up for by the fact that the bus stop into Alicante town is right outside; the tram stop is 2 minutes walk; the beach is…

title: Delighted with this hotel!
review: We were given a warm welcome here, the hotel was spotless and perfectly positioned to enjoy the delights of San Juan and Alicante. Offers great value for money, our room was large with a seaview and a nice private balcony. Caters mainly for Spanish, but reception staff spoke good English.  They booked a taxi for us to take us to the airport, all done efficiently and with a smile. This hotel is unpretentious, does what it says on the tin and we'd not hesitate to return.  San Juan feels like a million miles from Benidorm, which we could see from our balcony. Probably best suited to a more mature clientele, at least out of high season. The place seemed to go quiet around 11pm but that suited us! Plenty of life in Alicante city, ten minutes away for those who want it.

title: Perfect choice!
review: We have just returned from an 8 day stay at this Hotel and have nothing but praise. On arrival we were given a room at the rear of the hotel (for all day sun) but asked to be moved to a higher floor with a sea view. This was done without any problem at all and minimal fuss and we were given a room on the 6th floor with a super kingsize bed and lovely view of the sea and pool. I would recommend a high floor room simply because of the fantastic views. Outside the hotel has a lovely terrace set out with tables and chairs which we made good use of during the day and especially the evenings. As per previous reviews the drinks prices are very reasonable ( 1.75 euros for an enormous glass of Sangria!) so it was lovely to sit out on the terrace after our evening meal and chat with other…

title: Great Hotel and Location
review: Great hotel just 15 min's outside of Alicante, very near an absolutely fantastic beach. Eating places nearby and small shops for everything you will need for your trip. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel which is great for getting around, bus 21 and 22 are for Alicante and back to the hotel. around the corner is a tram stop. The hotel itself is very clean and great helpful English speaking staff very professional. The room was great large and very clean serviced daily. The breakfast was a little weak on choice for fine to fill the tummy. The hotels weak spot would be Wifi is not free it must be purchased 1euro for 1 hour, 4 euro for the day. Try to not to use taxis I booked the airport taxi as arrival was late no bus on after midnight, never showed and got charged 42…

title: Clean, Tidy, Friendly - good 3 star hotel
review: Just stayed for 3 nights whilst property hunting and found this hotel was ample for our needs. Very clean and smart, and friendly -  my only ask would be that there is a provision of tea/coffee facilities in the room, no worries really, but would just be that final provision for your customers  Drinks from bar are keenly priced and very reasonable, and a good mix of brands  Good location with bus and tram outside the front door, your only 5 miles from the centre of Alicante but have stunning beaches for Sun Juan on your doorstep.  Airport about 30 mins away in traffic

title: feedback
review: Very clean and staff very helpful. I would recommend for a peaceful relaxing break and close to beach. I also enjoyed the pool. The cost of bar drinks were very reasonable. The beach was amazing, although woul dhave liked a couple more bars to choose from.

title: Delivers what it says
review: 2 x 2 couples looking for a short sunny break close to beach in a clean hotel with modern amenities. Castilla delivered every thing we were looking for, the exceptionally hot weather was a bonus! Some Brits searching for an English breakfast were the only glum faces, it is Spain and is obviously very popular with Spanish holiday makers. Can't think of any downsides.

title: Nice Hotel, good location
review: Stayed at the Hotel Castilla for 4 nights in September.  We arrived about midnight and were greeted warmly by the receptionist who was very efficient.  Rooms were nice, clean and a good balcony to relax on !  We only stayed Bed & Breakfast and there was plenty to choose from.  English cooked was Bacon and Scrambled Eggs, every day ! but there was plenty of other options.  Hotel is situated just across the road from the lovely San Juan Beach so is ideal.  We did not use the pool facilities as we went to the Beach every day.  Outside is a bus stop which we caught a bus to Alicante which cost 1.45 euro, coming back we got a taxi as it was after midnight and it only cost 12 euros ! There are plenty of Bars and Restaurants nearby. Would recommend booking a Taxi back to the Airport…

title: Clean rooms  Comfy Beds Large balcony
review: We booked this on the second day in Alicante at short notice due to previous hotel was a building site  This hotel saved the holiday . Would definitely recommend this to others Its a big commercial hotel not particularly quaint and a tad clinical but very good value for money .  Very clean . Great service and  close to beach  Could do with a fridge in the room but close to 24hr supermarket  Double beds were great and very big

title: wonderful
review: Second time here and will be coming again. So close to beach and transport in to Alicante town. The best vodka,served in a super large glass with loads of ice. Staff helpful. Hotel spotlessly clean. Only negative is short pool opening hours.

title: Great location and value for your money
review: We happened upon this great hotel when we arrived in the area looking for accommodation at midnight 2 weeks ago. We were thrilled to learn that they had a vacancy for us, and we were given a very nice room on the 7th floor with a balcony. We had views of the coast to the north and south (between some of the other buildings closer to the shoreline) which we thought was great, especially because the room cost only €140 including breakfast. Breakfast was great - a very sufficient buffet complete with cold items and a few hot ones. The pool and surrounding deck were excellent, as was the hotel's location - I enjoyed a beautiful 5 km morning run along the coastal boardwalk, which was merely a 2 minute walk from the hotel's front door. A beautiful never-ending white sand beach is also…

title: Great hotel
review: We stayed at this hotel for four nights at the end of June, we arrived at the hotel 11am we were able to store our cases, as to early to go to our room, we went back at 1:30pm and our room was ready. We had a twin room on the fifth floor, Big room, nice bathroom, lovely big balcony, the only thing missing from the room is a fridge, but there is a 24 hour supermarket just a few mins from the hotel, where u can buy ice for your drinks, the breakfast was good lots of choice, the staff in the hotel were very friendly, the beach is fantastic only a few mins from the hotel,  we will be returning to this hotel, great value for money

title: Perfect for a relaxing escape but the wifi...
review: We love San Juan, the beach the restaurants and this hotel is just perfectly located, it would probably become our first choice whenever we want to escape for a quiet weekend on a Spanish beach but not for more than a week-end, because unfortunately we can't live without internet for too long and the wifi connection in our room wasn't just good enough for us with the signal going on and off all the time. Apart from that we were very pleased with the hotel, still think is good value for money and still thing we will definitely go back for another week-end

title: What do you want?
review: Have been back from this hotel for a week and would return tomorrow if I was able to!  We chose this hotel due to the location and the facilities. It is situated in St Juan just outside Alicante and as said before in other reviews handy for the tram and the bus. The Tram Stop is just up the road and is named Londres and the 21 and 22 buses stop right outside and the adult fare into or out of Alicante is currently 1.45 Euros – to return to the hotel the 21/22 bus stop is by the port. It does not matter which one you get as the route only varies through the residential part.  We arrived and we were allocated room 620 which is at the sea end of the hotel and has the huge balcony with sun in the morning (sun rise over Benidorm) and shade late afternoon. Very clean and comfortable…

title: Cant wait to go back
review: Had a wonderful week at this hotel, very close to the beautiful clean sandy beach. Very quiet and clean room with very spacious balcony with sea and mountain views. Read previous reviews so avoided eating in restaurant apart from breakfast which was more than adequate despite not serving hot foods. Staff spoke English and by reading the guide in the room we were able to change the tv channels to English which a previous reviewer said was not possible. Would have liked wifi in the room but there were sofas in reception area where you could use the internet. Buses directly outside door and very cheap to Alicante. Although the Town was quiet when we arrived, towards the end of the week it started to pick up and more restaurants and shops opened. so would probably go a little later…

title: Relaxation
review: Just came back from a week in hotel Castilla lovely clean hotel the room had balcony with pool an sea view. Wifi only available in one corner of the hotel in front of reception a bit inconvenient but ok. Paublo bar waiter very helpful. Marianne at reception also very helpful. Transport second to none bus tram right outside the hotel. Great for 20 minute trip into Alicante city or Benidorm if you want to visit more lively places. As Playa San Juan  is a quite place!! Has a beautiful beach on you're door step  some nice shops restaurants particularly the Indian restaurant very friendly staff great food. Its a great place to stay mainly Spanish speaking but a few Spanish words learned are nice to have an appreciated. Will we come back? Absolutely!!

title: amazing
review: beautiful - to the room, pool, staff, resturant.. everything was amazing, 'perfect' should i stay, stayed for only a week with my family, the kids enjoyed every minute of it.. will deff be staying here again!!

title: A little gem
review: Just back from 4 nights at this hotel.  For €160 its great value. The room was lovely with lots of storage space. It could have done with tea and coffee making facilities tho!  Everything was spotlessly clean and the staff were very helpful and friendly. Every one we spoke to also spoke English. We did not eat at the hotel but did buy drinks. The room had air con but we never needed it as the room did nit get that hot.  We were given free wifi whuch worked in the room. The pool area was basic and a little noisy from surrounding traffic but it was never difficult to get a sun bed and easy to relax in.  The hotel is a 2 minute walk to the beach front which is lovely. The beach is long and sandy, lots of children's climbing frames and outside gym equipment and a great atmosphere. …

title: Good value
review: I'm writing this review on behalf of my 64 year old mum and her twoolder sisters! They stayed here last week in a triple room and paid about 60 euros each for 3 days. They said it was really good for the money, very clean, not much of a view from their room though but had a small balcony. The beach was really close and was very clean. The breakfast was good, your basic continental breakfast, but everything you needed. About 30 mins on the bis to Alicante. The only real downside that they said was that none of the staff spoke English. They found it very hard to communicate as no one understood what they were asking and they didn't seem very friendly. But overall a great hotel for the price.

title: Perfect for beach holiday
review: Great location with number of shops, restaurants and a beautiful beach basically at the doorstep. 20mins to Alicante city centre by bus which stops just outside the hotel (No. 21 & 22). Rooms and the hotel in general are very clean. I would definitely stay there again. Good value for money . Hotel bar and restaurant lacked atmosphere and the food was poor, but it wasn't an issue as there are plenty of restaurants in the area to chose from. Breakfast was cold buffet only, very basic and same every day.

title: Perfectly adequate for purpose
review: We shared 3 single beds in a room and used Alicante as a base for rock climbing every day for 11 days using a hire car. With half board accommodation this meant we didn't have to think about food during our trip. Breakfast was basic, but adequate and the evening meals were varied, but not special. The  3 beers for the price of 2 offer meant we didn't really stray from the hotel in the evenings, having been out far and wide during each day. Our room was clean, well serviced each day and facilities were adequate. We always take our own travel kettle and T bags as there are never any in the rooms. Staff were mostly friendly and helpful and some spoke very good English. The free Wi-Fi was a bit variable and suffered at busy times. The beach facilities and hotel pool would be very…

title: EXCELLENT VALUE FOR MONEY - EXCEEDED EXPECTATIONS
review: For €42/night my expectations were not high.....having said that, I was very pleasantly surprised....large, clean room, great balcony and very comfortable bed.....friendly and helpful staff who spoke English.....many restaurants nearby, all within walking distance.....decent sized pool with sun loungers....breakfast barely adequate, however, and why no hot water boiler/cup for tea/coffee in the room?......it is beyond me why hotels do not provide this latter facility.....no English-speaking TV channel which was a shame...only need one channel.....nice to wake up and know what is going on in the world....overall exceeded expectations at the price so cannot really complain to any great degree.....

title: Exceptional value, enjoyable stay!
review: I booked this hotel for a few days relaxing break in March 2014.   The hotel itself was extremely clean on the outside which made a good impression, and this was reinforced on the  inside.  The reception staff were very friendly, professional and helpful,  My room was basic but very clean, nicely furnished and comfortable. The only drawback being no tea or coffee making facilities in the room.  I had breakfast and evening meal.  The breakfast was a continental buffet with a choice of cereal, yoghurt, breads, meats, fruit juice and a coffee machine, the coffee being really nice!!  The evening meal was waiter service and was three course with a choice of starter and main meal and a variety of dessert.  There was fish, meat, salads, rice, potatoes and vegetables.  All of very good…

title: Value4£
review: I stayed mid November, I'm sure it would be delightful when warmer! The hotel is clean and pleasant, lovely staff, very nice location close to an enormous immaculetly-kept beach. A standard "continental" style breakfast, which is perfectly adequate. Excellent value for money.

title: Pleasant enough for the price
review: I stayed at the Hotel Castilla Alicante in mid October. The hotel is quite a distance from central Alicante but is easily accessible by bus (number 22) or tram. The journey into central Alicante is around 8km and takes about 30 minutes. There is a bus stop immediately outside the hotel and the tram stops aren’t too far away either.  The hotel is rather large and generally clean without being exceptional. The rooms are a standard size with television (and remote control), moderate size bathrooms with plenty of towels supplied and replaced daily. Shower gel sachets are supplied too but are hardly enough for a proper wash.  Free WiFi is supplied in three day blocks via a temporary username and password. Once it has expired reception will issue you another one on request. All the…

title: Very enjoyable stay
review: I cannot understand how people are complaining about this hotel. I have just spent 5 days there and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. The Hotel was extremely busy hosting guests for the IPC competition. Many of these were in wheelchairs and I saw nothing but  hard work and helpfulness from the staff. The restaurant was fully booked due to this event but staff ensured I was looked after and received dinner. After a slight hitch with my booking my room was changed as soon as a larger one became available after the event was over. It may be a little old fashioned but it is spotlessly clean in the Hotel and and around the pool area. This is a 3* premises and I found it very good value for money. Well done Hotel Castilla, I will be more than happy to return.

title: Great Weekend Break
review: My Boyfriend and I have just returned after a long weekend at Castilla. We got there the Friday morning and the check in was fine - we had been allocated one of the more superior rooms on the 5th floor (502) which didnt overlook the sea, but if you leaned out you could see it from the HUGE balcony! The bed wasnt the comfiest, but have slept in alot worse and had a good nights sleep! The bathroom was fine - quite modern and the room was clean. The only problem with the room is the lack of English Channels! only BBC news... Its about 50m to the beach, just under a minuite walk and its the most gorgeous white sand beach...and it has a lovely promenade for a good stroll in the evenings. It is quite far from Alicante, but you can get a bus for E1.45. And there is a night bus at the…

title: terrible service, not a bad hotel
review: The staff were very unfriendly, although the hotel was not so bad. Other things that werent so nice - the breakfast was appalling and the shower gel were in pouches which weren't all that easy to use and the quantity was too little. Good things: The hotel is really close to the beach and if you have a car there's enough parking nearby.

title: Very Clean and Efficient
review: We very much enjoyed our stay. The hotel is exceptionally clean and very convenient for public transport into Alicante. All staff were friendly and helpful, with excellent English spoken by the receptionists - especially the lovely Fran! We would happily stay here again.

title: clean and tidy
review: clean and tidy hotel. Two small lifts, stairs ok to top floor, 8 floors. Friendly reception. 150metres from Londres tram stop. Only slept at hotel so no food review, plenty of food outlets nearby, beach across the road. No kettle in room. Bathroom ok but basic. Rooms at the end of building towards sea have a long balcony. Beach is very good, tram service excellent, town has enough for a day or two to explore, castle good, tram to Benidorm for day out not expensive. No complaint overall.

title: Good value
review: Stayed here for 2 nights. Staff very helpful and polite. A clean and well run hotel. The pool area was adequate and suffers from shade from the building next door, but could potentially get very busy. However most guests used the lovely San Juan beach 2 minutes walk away. It would have been nice to have direct access to the cafe though. You can park in the street right outside. Getting to Alicante centre is no problem, just get a 21 or 22 bus outside the hotel. They go all the way to the esplanade, about 25 minutes. €1.45 each way. There is a nice cafe in the hotel which seems popular with locals so we didn't use the restaurant. Overall a pleasant and well located hotel

title: Excellent holiday
review: This is an excellent hotel with very helpful staff who all speak a little English, some were fluent. I recommend that you stay in Alicante at the end of June/ beginning of July. We saw an excellent Fiesta in Alicante where they build amazing structure from polystyrene all over the city which they then set fire to at the end of the week, After they have doused the fires the firemen turn their hoses on the crowd as part of the fun. It really was fantastic. The very next night there were fireworks on the Alicante beach at midnight, this went on for 5 nights to celebrate the start of summer. They were without doubt the best fireworks I have ever seen. We used the tram nearly every day because it is very cheap, costing only 8 euros each for a return trip to Altea which is a 2hr trip…

title: Very satisfied with this basic hotel
review: Spent 4 nights in May. Great location, spotless, food reasonable, agree with the breakfast being very very limited, being one meat and one cheese, but for the price I consider it good value. Pool area while small is nice, although being so close to the beach this didn't matter.

title: Good hotel at a good rate
review: We stayed here for a weekend in July. The hotel staff were very friendly, the rooms were clean and the bed comfortable. The bathroom was clean and spacious enough.  The rooms all have large balconies with (plastic) chairs, so you can sit outside.  The hotel is close to the beach and there are enough restaurants in the area to keep you happy.

title: Nice location, nice staff but not a very nice building
review: The location in San Juan, Alicante is great. Very close to the beach and as far as I know all rooms have seaview. We stayed in 2 rooms and had a nice view from both of them. We you get a room on the left side of the building (beach side) at the end of the hall you'll get a big balcony with your room. They called that room a suite but eventhough it had a kingsize bed I wouldn't call it a suite. Rooms are not small but ain't big either. No fridge, no tea or coffee maker. TV and airconditioning are there. Decent bathroom but in one room slightly more outdated then in the other we stayed in. So I think some of the rooms have been re-done. Swimmingpool is nice and offers plenty of room the sit or lie down. It's got a restaurant/bar at the groundfloor and you can sit outside drinking…

title: Nice hotel!
review: We were nicely  surprised about hotel. We also were happy about the location- it is in more calm part of city but still good connection to city centre and tramps stop very close. The nice san juan beach just few minutes away. Rooms are big and balcony also. It's is really clean place and each day you find your room cleaned, towels changed. We really liked hotel terrace where we liked in evening to have a drink sit and check emails. Staff friendly, breakfast quite ok also. Like for 3 stars hotel is good I think. Reception were not most cheerful people ever but their English was enough good to explain you anything you ask or answer any questions. The parking of hotel is like 10 euros per day plus taxes. Overall nice hotel.

title: Could be so simply improved
review: This hotel is a reasonably priced 3 star. It is clean and well located for the excellent beach and the limited attractions of San Juan. Easy to access from Alicante airport via the city.  With a few simple tweaks my lasting impression would have been so much more positive.  In general the staff were fine but one male and one female receptionists require retraining in customer relations. A smile and a friendly greeting on arrival is not difficult. Much preferable to a bark of "You have a reservation? Passports!" When there was a powercut in the evening, friendly reassurance was required rather than a waved away hand gesture.  To be told to turn the air conditioning down was not clever either since this was a major factor in the hotel selection.  Pool opening hours and shade…

title: Great Value
review: If you are a couple, the double-bedded room we were given was of excellent size and the bed must've been a double-king, it was huge and very comfortable, we would highly recommend.  All of the rooms look-out to the same view - unspectacular, but the service, staff and cleanliness of the hotel more than make up for it.

title: Nice hotel shame about the food
review: Hotel was lovely very near the beach, good local transport right outside the door of hotel.  The food was not so good, breakfast was the same every morning.  We were half bard, out of seven nights I would say three were ok.  WIne very good 6 Euros a bottle.   Staff were helpful.  Rooms were clean and comfortable no complaints.  Taxi from airport 35 euros.

title: Many good points
review: This 3 star hotel is very good value. It has many good points- and a few less than good.  The latter refers primarily to the bed and the pillows, which are incredibly hard,inflexible and uncomfortable.Also, the very well maintained swimming pool has rather limited opening hours (10.30a.m.- 3p.m. then 5p.m.-7p.m.). The breakfast is ample and satisfactory, except for the slowest toaster in Spain! Too many guests take food from the restaurant at breakfast, which is a shame and the hotel specifically asks guests to desist.  Apart from these points, the hotel is kept wonderfully clean and rooms are a good size.Ask for a pool view room if possible. Take your own toiletries as the hotel ones are minimal and not great quality.  The hotel location is a huge bonus. The bus stops right…

title: Great location & hotel
review: I stayed here with a friend at the beginning of June and was not disappointed. Hotel staff speak good English and were helpful. Rooms were of a good size and clean. Lobby was nice to relax in late afternoons.    Breakfast in the hotel was usual continental croissants, yogurts meats etc and evening meal was set 3 course different each nite which was fine.    Gorgeous beach a very short walk away with loungers that you pay for for the day (4 euros each) plenty of bars and restaurants around to sample local food & sangria etc and the tram system which is close to the hotel was really easy to negotiate and cheap. We went to benidorm for the day and a return trip was only 6 euros.   All in all, a very pleasant stay would definitely stay again location was perfect for a nice chilled…

title: Good overall, but not perfect
review: I stayed here for 3 nights (in 2 June, out 5 June 2013) and would rate it overall as pretty decent for the price paid and generally meriting its 3-star rating. I booked my stay on-line just a few days earlier through booking.com and the booking process was seamless and trouble-free. I was booked in on a b&b basis, although I did eat a lunch and an evening meal in the 'cafeteria'; apart from breakfast each day I did not eat in the main restaurant, so cannot comment about it.  The room: - I had a room with a partial sea-view which was quite spacious; it was almost at the front of the hotel. It had a double-bed (a 'king-size'); when checking-in and after ascertaining that I was alone (although I had paid for 2-person occupancy), the lady at check-in took some trouble to allocate me…

title: Nothing special but nothing bad
review: We stayed here for 4 nights and it was perfectly pleasant. Nothing really went wrong but as we didn't spend much time in the hotel we can't say it was bad!   We never ate in the hotel so can't comment on the food.  Staff seemed ok, though again as we didn't spend a lot of time there we didn't have a lot of interaction with them.  Either we had a different bathroom to everyone else but I can't believe no-one commented on it! It has obviously been done up recently with nice black and white tiles and a rainforest style shower, it was great.  As everyone else has said, it is very easy to get into Alicante with the tram only a few minutes walk away. We did check out a night early, nothing to do with the hotel but we went to stay with the in laws in Gata further up the coast. We got…

title: Food Poisoning? Rude...Arrogant member of staff for check in and out!
review: Hi, San Juan is a lovely area....Nice beach...Lots of nice bars and restaurants and very friendly people. And then the hotel.....We had paid extra for a double room with sea view,upon check in we were sent to a room with 2 single beds and a poor view,was then told it was not possible by the witch on reception to change to a double room,we complained and she eventually gave in and moved us to the room we paid for! Food was awful in the restaurant and I suspect I suffered with food poisoning from undercooked lukewarm food. Despite paying for half board we ate out as it was that bad! Last day we had a late flight back and enquired about a shower room to freshen up in and get changed in,we was told it wasn't possible and to use the toilets! Such a shame with this hotel as it does…

title: Uncomfortable bed, noisy hotel, unpleasant staff
review: I would recommend the hotel management attempt to sleep in the bed in room 212, it creaked horribly everytime you moved and both my husband and I had quite bad neck/back aches the following day.  Both for the check in and check out I found the reception staff patronizing and always seemed to want to serve the peope behind me first.
