I had a bottle of cava and asked for it to be put in the room in the afternoon, we got back at 4 and cava want there so phoned reception, who said it woud be up immediately, an hour later still no cava, phoned again and the receptionist, no apology, said oh yes the guy wasnt here (the only one with legs I presume) we'll send it now. It hadnt occurred to him to call me and let me know it was delayed. Ive worked as a training manager for the hospitalty…

title: clean, quiet, great location
review: a really nice, clean and spacious room with a must-have for me balcony where you can just lounge on the chair and sip in a drink and puff a cigare. Housekeeping is very efficient and ladies do the job quickly and unobtrusively. Location is quiet, with few good bars just around the corner, 24h convenience store is on the same street. Beach is just a short stroll, with many volleyball facilities and on-beach working out and fitness equipment. Ole good McDoanlds is 10 mins walk. Had great time and would deffinitely come back.

title: The hotel was quiet, clean, and located close to the beach.
review: The hotel was quiet, clean, and located close to the beach. My only complaints is that the breakfast was a bit poor. A lot of white bread, cakes, cup-cakes, jam and sugar, Bus stop right outside the main entrance that takes you to alicante sentrum.

title: Nice Hotel but
review: Stayed here Mid May. The Hotel is fine, clean, nice rooms, great location, but think twice before you book the Restaurant.The food was OK but not much of it and the choice was the worst I have ever encountered in a holiday Hotel. For a start the Restaurant only opened at 8-30 each night, there were only Two starters each night, one of which was always Soup, and Two Mains, one Meat and One Fish dish. We stayed for nine nights and the same three sweets were offered every night, breakfast was all cold food, again no variation. As I said Nice Hotel but eat out.

title: Excellent base to explore from
review: Just stayed here at end of May 2013. In honesty couldn't fault much.  This is a great hotel to base yourself. The previous reviews about transport links are right with buses into Alicante outside the door (1.45 Euro each way). The (long) beach is a five minute walk with cafe stops along it.  One of the previous reviewers explained how to get there and their description was spot on - I've pasted this below (with a slight addition).  Outside to left of the hotel are plenty of shops. The 24 hour supermarket is great, and if you turn left again there are more cafes, a tabac and an ATM.  Breakfast is continental but good enough. Plenty to eat and drink. And the cafe bar prices throughout the day are good.  The rooms themselves do what they need to and have all the amenities. There…

title: Good value
review: Stayed 5 nights in May and we paid less than £40/night for the room including breakfast so not expensive for what we got. Rooms were clean and comfortable with bath and shower but walls a bit thin, partial sea view from higher floors. Good efficient and cheap public transport was few minutes walk and the beach was a few minutes walk too. A lovely beach too! Friendly and helpful staff and a good selection of bars and restaurants nearby, In summary, a very enjoyable stay at a very reasonable cost

title: Location!
review: This is a perfect hotel for people who want both the beach and the city of Alicante. It is a clean,nice hotel with a decent breakfast. well, we missed the egg and baco!. The hotel is close to the beach and you can easy go to Alicante city by tram - 1.45 e. We will return!

title: good 3* hotel, but POOR breakfast
review: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for eight nights in May. Generally the hotel is as a standard 3* hotel, I want to agree with most of reviews with good points, location - very close to beach and quiet place in a residential area of Alicante, staff very helpful, clean room, bus - in front of hotel to get to city center, tram - 1 minute walk. But, we booked the room with breakfast, which in my opinion was a mistake. It costs 6 euro, which I think it doesn't worth. It was the POOREST breakfast ever we had at a 3* star hotel. There's very little choice, there's no hot food at all, 1 type of ham, 1 type of cheese, a basket with fruits, butter, jam, some yogurts in the fridge, 2 types of juices, 2 coffee machines, muffin, some choice of cookies, toaster bread, rolls, 1 type of…

title: Excellent value and location
review: Stayed for long weekend with 76 year old mother.  Rooms were simple but clean and all had balconies  (not much sun though due to direction they face).  Pool cold but clean and big enough to have a decent swim, with plenty of loungers, chairs and tables.  Breakfast was cold buffet and everything was fresh and tasty.  Tram and bus stops are right outside hotel and excursions are available (although we didn't go on any).  Beach is only one block away and the surrounding area is full of good restaurants and bars - average price for 3 course meal + bread+ wine was 13 Euros and a small beer and tapa cast E1.50.  Staff were quite formal but friendly and helpful when asked for information.

title: Perfect hotel in Alicante
review: We stay a few days in the Castilla Hotel in Alicante in the begin of May. It's a very clean hotel with a very friendly staff. The breakfast is good and the way to the beach is very short. The next time when we are in Alicante we should choose this hotel again! Perfect!

title: Castilla, where is the chef?
review: Hello Chums! Well now, let's look at this hotel with the benefit of the healing quality of time. The weather in Alicante at the time Late April 13, was pretty awful and unseasonal, We did have a few sunny but windy days.  On arrival we were delighted to see our old friend Mr Chumley Warner on reception, much bustling and hustling saw us get into our rather bleak room. This is a 3 star hotel in a potentially 4* location. Room was clean, quiet and view over west side as all the rooms are. Staff I must mention were generally very good, most of the waitresses also.  Located on the tram and bus line and near the beach and shops could have made this an ideal hotel. The decoration of the dining room in black and grey window nets was an interior designers travesty and very dreary. The…

title: Nice relaxing Hotel
review: My Husband and I stayed at Castilla for several days in February .......... we found the staff all to be so very friendly and helpful. The Hotel was kept spotlessly clean and tidy.  A special mention to the Reception staff for their patience explaining the tram services!! And also a special mention to the waiter Jose from Argentina - what a pleasant young man - hola from the Manchester City fans!!  The room we were allocated was a corner room with great views out to the sea..... kept very clean and the bed was super comfortable too, I would suggest asking for a high floor when booking...... there are two functioning lifts. Breakfast was fine - mostly continental but for the English pallette there was cereal and fruit, juices, toast and preserves, yoghurts, danish pastries etc…

title: Great place 20 minutes from Alicante 'central'
review: The main draw for me going to this hotel was the San Juan Beach which was a 2 minute walk from the hotel.  The beach is just miles and miles of beach with a wide walking/running/cycling area.  When going on the beach the first 50 metres deep is volleyball, football, basketball, children areas – all free of course.  Then the rest of the beach, as you get closer to the sea, is either plain sand for you to lay your towel on or pay 4 euro for a sunbed.  The hotel is in a late 70s tower block, one of many in that area which are predominantly residential.  It has had a makeover with a very nice reception and all areas were spotlessly clean.  Front desk staff spoke perfect English and were very helpful.  Bar staff were very helpful but as you’d expect with a lesser command of English. …

title: Nice Budget Hotel & Excellent location
review: Nice hotel in very good location, very close to the sea and restaurants, but in same time is not noisy at all. Rooms are big and have some sea-view. Cleaning average, could be better. Breakfast simple, but sufficient. Staff is pleasant and helpful. l defiantly will stay there again, as budget traveler.

title: Great Staff & Location
review: Stayed here for a week in March. Staff could not have been more helpful with hotel staff getting special food for coeliac breakfast. Location is very good with tram /bus stops right next to it for both Alicante or Benidorm direction. Hotel basic but very clean with all staff very helpful.

title: Great Budget Hotel,Better Than Expected for the cost
review: My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights, we were looking for something reasonable but on a budget. The hotel & rooms are all very clean.  The reception is great and the staff were very helpful.  They arranged taxi's, showed us where and how to use the busses and trams, suggested places to visit and gave direction.  Couldn't have asked for more. Weather was a little chilly so didn't use the pool, but it was clean and we would have given a bit more sun.   Breakfast was great, good selection of food. Hotel is very close to San Jose beach.  It's a 30 minute bus ride to town for a couple of euros or about 15 euros for a taxi. Would definitely use this hotel again.

title: Pleasant night
review: We stayed in the Playa San Juan, in Castilla hotel just for one night. It was a quiet, resting night in spite of the fact that people were getting ready for Carnaval that week-end. There is a tram stop nearby and you can get to the center of Alicante in 12 mins. The proximity to the beach is great and we'd love to come back again in summer.

title: Exceeded Expectations
review: We stayed at Hotel Castilla Alicante for one week at the start of October, We were not sure what to expect but were encouraged by the good reviews on trip advisor. I can honestly say we were very satisfied, lovely clean hotel, nice room with balcony and use of the room safe for Eur 2 per night, the friendly and accomodating staff made us feel very welcome, in particular the staff on reception were so helpful, If we have one small quibble it is that the AC in the room was not terribly good and made little impact, so we were glad to have a sliding balcony door which we could open as required. Breakfast was plentiful and all in all added up to very good value for money. Easy access to the beach as noted by others and a choice of restaurants in the immediate vicinity. We will be…

title: Great budget hotel
review: We stayed at this hotel for a week towards the end of September.  The hotel itself is very clean - maid service every day and the staff are very friendly and speak good English. We didn't eat in the hotel so cannot comment on the food.   The hotel is not too far from Alicante itself and the local area is nice.  The beach is beautiful, very clean and impressive looking.  Would 100% come back to stay at this hotel again if I were to re-visit the area.

title: Hotel Castilla Alicante
review: Well deserves its 3 star rating. Spotlessly clean everywhere.Great pool, never crowded. The food was top class for the money, very Spanish but that's no bad thing, though I drew the line at cuttlefish. The hotel and indeed the San Juan area is very Spanish  - nothing wrong with that at all but a little Spanish goes a long way. The receptionists speak excellent English & very helpful too, although the waiters' English is limited but nice friendly people (apart from one). Hard to fault anything with the hotel really.  The tram service is very efficient & a good deal. For 1.40 you can get into Alicante & the lovely little resort of el Campello and day trip to Benidorm just 6.20. You can take the airport bus for 2.75 & get off at Luceros then the tram for 1.40 to Londres or La…

title: A week of relaxation.
review: Having stayed there before I cannot fault this Hotel.Easy access to the town and only 2 minutes from the beautiful beach with golden sand and sunshine in the high 20,s in mid September. very Spanish and unspoiled with genuine Spanish food and great tapas..

title: Fantastic staff.
review: The staff were very very helpful, nothing was too much trouble. We stayed for seven nights & the room was cleaned every day. It was 2 mins walk to the beach & had plenty of restaurants & shops very close by. The bus to the middle of alienate stopped outside the door of the hotel. Only negative is the bed was a bit uncomfortable. Will def stay again!

title: Lovely beach hotel
review: This hotel and its surroundings are a bit of a gem in this area of Spain. The local area, San Juan,  is mostly frequented by Spaniards in their holiday appartments and hotels are few around.  The features we most enjoyed were the short walk to the lovely beach, the pool, an abundance of restaurants nearby. Getting to the city by taxi is not cheap but not horrendous either. The tram is cheap but not very frequent.  I´d reccomend this to people with children or those who really want to relax on the beach and by the pool. Not so much for getting out and about too much. Our room was fairly large with a renewed bathroom. An extra bed was available for our children. The balcony sort of doubles as another room for when the children have fallen asleep which we thought was practical. But…

title: 1 night stay location great for beach
review: stopped for 1 night september 2012. reason was the location, 100m from great beach. tram / bus links on your doorstep to alicante harbour etc. ate locally in one of the nearby restaurants. hotel room good . didn.t use any of the facilities but reception staff help full and friendly.. used hotel as a stopover for short journey to airport next day. would use again

title: Very pleasant hotel
review: Very pleasant hotel, clean, with friendly and helpful staff and situated just 2 minutes walk from the wonderful beach San Juan. Good value for money!  Breakfast was fine, continental, with good selection of breads and fruits.  I would recommend this hotel for those who need the sea and a quieter atmosphere.

title: Lovely beach
review: The hotel is 2mins walk from a beautiful sandy beach, which has a few bars/restaurants along it, and a McDonalds. If you are after crazy nightlife, don't go here as it has a quieter atmosphere, yet there are still plenty of places to get a few cocktails in! Breakfast was average - there was a full continental and bacon/scrambled egg, and fruit juices. The pool was quiet when I went, and there were always sunbeds free as they can't be reserved here. Room cleaned every day, and all the staff were very friendly, allowing us to borrow a knife from the dining room to make lunch in our room for example!

title: First Rate Hotel in Alicante
review: Have just returned from an 8 day stay in the Castilla Hotel, Alicante.  This is an excellent value for money hotel.  The Hotel is located about 100m from the Playa San Juan, which is a long sandy beach, about a 15 minute taxi drive from Alicante Airport (€30-€35 for the taxi).   Rooms in the hotel are a good size and are cleaned every day.  There is a €2 charge per day for the safe in the room, which is not unreasonable.  Staff are helpful - we were able to borrow an adapter from reception and just returned it to them when leaving.  Because of its location, you can hear street traffic from time to time but it is not overly intrusive.  Also the floors in the rooms are tiled which means you can hear people walking in other rooms if they have their shoes on and you can hear…

title: Good hotel, near fabulous beach
review: Thank you very much for the comment Slatts 25, was a great pleasure to welcome you to our modest hotel on the beach, and we are very happy that I found everything to their liking. We look forward to seeing us in the future.   For any questions you know where you have a friend.

title: Good family hotel
review: Just got back from 4 night break at this hotel and had an excellent time.  Hotel very close to fabulous beach.  Room was decent sized and very clean.  Balcony big enough and with view of the pool and the sea.  Didn't eat at the hotel as menu was limited but there was plenty of choice of restaurants and bars right by the sea

title: A nice Hotel next to a fantastic beach
review: A really good family hotel - reasonably priced, good sized pool, 2 blocks from the beach, restaurants close by, buffet breakfast was decent, beds pretty comfy, wifi only worked downstairs near lobby (but was complimentary), front desk staff were really great - always friendly and helped with any questions / requests.  If I ever come back to Alicante would happily stay here again.

title: Comfortable & worth the money!!
review: Early this month I spend one week at this Hotel. It is nothing luxurious but it served my purpose of relaxing during the off-season period without the tourist masses. The Hotel is located just a few yards from the San Juan beach which is about three miles long, white sand and almost deserted this time of the year. Temperatures vary from 50 to 70 degrees, water is temperate and allows a dip sometimes. Prices during the off-season are excellent and services are adequate. There is a cafeteria but no formal restaurant. The Hotel is well connected with a very efficient tram passing just in front of it which will take you to anyplace in the city of Alicante or nearby beaches.

title: Good.
review: This Hotel is very good. nothing fancy, nothing luxurious but very well located and clean. mine (#502) was a very spacious room with a very large terrace. we have dined one night sitting on the terrace. Wifi works perfectly. Parking is really free and on site. The stuff is not so "happy and friendly" but it's ok. rooms are not overlooking the beach but i think it is better otherwsie they would be too noisy. maybe during thte summer this palce (the hotel, all the hotel and the San Juan plage) must be very "crowded" and noisy. In november i have enjoyed it, the beach is really beautiful.

title: One night comfortable stay....exceeded expectations for price
review: We stayed here for just one night as we were flying out of Spain from Alicant (had been staying in Valencia for the MotoGP). This was a cheap hotel but it far exceeded our expectations for its price. The girl on the reception was very helpful with directions to the airport, where to eat and where to park our hire car. The room was very clean, a good size, great hot powerful shower. We had a balcony, overlooking the pool and the sea a little way off. Definitely would come back here for a quiet family holiday. Not at all what I expected. Thought it would be roudy and common but it wasn't at all. Breakfast included and was good.

title: Very nice, inexpensive hotel
review: I found the hotel excellent. Room a good size and comfortable. Staff helpful & spoke English. Breakfasts excellent including scrambled egg & bacon. We had 2 dinners in the hotel and the food was fine. Our room was on the 8th floor (our request) and we had a side sea view from the balcony. Location great - near an excellent beach with promenade, lots of shops and restaurants nearby, quiet and felt safe, bus and tram to Alicante pass hotel entrance and costs €1.25 each way to town centre (20 mins). This isn't a buzzing town centre location, more residential which we preferred. Excellent restaurant Los Charros nearby for a special occasion.  The only problem we found was that the restaurants in the vicinity open for dinner at 8.30pm - 9pm. This is normal for Spain but later than we…

title: great location
review: A block away from the beach, a bus stop in front of the hotel, a metro stop nearby.  It was great to have a balcony with a table and chairs, from which we could sort of view the sea.  The staff was very helpful and friendly.  It was a surprise to us that there was not a fridge/minibar in the room, nor was there a hairdryer!  Also, although this is a beach town and the hotel has a pool, they do not have a towel service for use at the pool or beach! They do have a snack bar and restaurant, good but a bit pricey.  But there are plenty of restaurants nearby.  Wifi was a bit spotty.

title: Quiet place and good value for money
review: Very nice hotel near to the beach San Juan that is quiet place and not crowdy like the beach in Alicante. Spacious rooms, all facilities inside exept hairdryer ( ask at the reception), various breakfast, cheep menu del dia for lunch and dinner, swimming pooll and other sport facilities ( SPA at a dictance of 500 m), friendly multilingual staff, good value for money for 3 stars hotel! I strongly recommend to all categories of travelers!

title: can't wait to go back
review: Chose the hotel last year when staying in the area. Great location, ideal for beach, shops and restaurants and local transport. Arrived about 10:30 in the morning and was lucky our room was ready.Reception staff lovely and friendly as were the rest of the staff. Nice clean room overlooking the swimming pool. Rooms were cleaned everyday and bedding/towels changed on a regular basis. There appeared to be more business people than holiday makers and very few families. Breakfast was good-nice range of food so could always find plenty to eat.  Excellent value in a great neigbourhood and close enough to Alicante for shopping and nightlife. Top tips learn some basic spanish not everyone in San Juan speaks english!               Use public transport from the airport - its quick,cheap…

title: Really nice hotel in San Juan Area
review: Couldn't of asked for a better hotel in the San Juan area than the Castilla Alicante. It is relatively easy to get to the hotel with public transport, but the taxi is relatively inexpensive as well. The room was quite spacious and had a balcony (i am pretty sure all rooms have a balcony). The room was very clean the entire time my companion and i were there and towels and toiletries replaced everyday. I'd also recommend the buffet breakfast because there is quite a bit of variety of foods on offer, including cereals, hams, yoghurts, hot food etc. The hotel is also in close proximity to quite a few restaurant so you will never go hungry. There is about 50m separating the hotel and the beach so you can easily walk through the side street to go there unless you would rather the…

title: Lovely hotel, lovely staff
review: Hi everyone,   I had a group of 44 work colleagues travelling to Alicante for a 'team-building' weekend from London. The prospect of booking anything for that many people is never appealing but Irene and Javi at Hotel Castilla were so so helpful in getting everything organised and very accommodating and patient as you can imagine you would have to be.   We had groups of people arriving throughout the day, the largest being 19 at once but check-in was not prolonged and despite saying check-in was at 4pm, all of our rooms were ready and people were allowed in from much much earlier.   Everybody's rooms were perfect for what we needed, comfy beds, clean, balconies with furniture, TV.   The pool was a good size and although the bathing area surrounding it wasn't huge the beach is…

title: We will come back for sure
review: Our trip began with all kinds of problems, hours of waiting in Stockholm airport, lost luggage, but the professionalism of all staff, especially Jose Antonio from reception solved all our problems. The excellent room, cleanliness, sea views and excellent food made ​​our stay unforgettable. Thank you very much.

title: The hotel was good, the receptionist AWFUL
review: A particular person in the reception was very unhelpful. When he saw you in the reception, he kept doing his own things even for 10 min. At the end of our holidays, we asked for late check-out, which was advertised in the board of the hotel and the very first answers was: NO. when we said it was available as in the ad, he asked us for our hotel room number. then he checked and he asked: when will you pay ALL these charges, 545euros? And we said we didnt have any charge. He was looking the wrong room number. Everything from him was very disappointing. The hotel manager should do something with this person (Jose Antonio said in his label name) in particular.  The rest of the hotel was good, very close to the beach, the buffet was very varied and the rooms were good too. It was sad…

title: not nice staff, not nice rooms...just Alicante
review: With my boyfriend drove in two weeks the whole of Spain, Barcelona, Madrid, Alicante, Burin, Valencia ... Valencia was the most beautiful:) sun, beach, old town,  in the hotel - not a nice Staff!!!  has a problem even finding a wine opener (you have to cope alone!!!!!) hotel building looks like a communist form  60s :/ Rooms-  dark and not nice, old  bathroom  with small windows. In the bath is a veil that looks terrible!!  In Alicante the most beautiful are the beaches ..  you can take a lot of sun  and swim of April!  I do not recommend this hotel...  In The city is a lot of small restaurants and good wine - great  to connoisseurs!!

title: Great value for money hotel
review: Stayed here with 2 children on a super value half board package. Room was very clean but very basic, bathrooms nice, spacious balcony but with views of the back of the kitchen.....why the 5 stars then.....well it just did exactly what it said it would for an excellent price. Free high speed wifi, great breakfast and excellent waiter service dinner (very nice when used to buffets and helping yourself).Pleasant lounge areas and a great street side cafe. Easy walking distance to one of the best beaches in spain.

title: Will definetely be back!
review: Fantastic location, good rooms with good sound insulation, best staff ever met in Spain - helpful,caring for the customers, extremely friendly and professional, reasonable prices in restaurant and bar. Excellent plumbing and amenities, super clean everywhere, quiet and clean pool facilities. An absolute must when visiting Alicante. Public transport by tramway or bus outside the hotel, cheap tickets to town centre 25-35 mins away.

title: Got an excellent bargin
review: One of the on line booking sites had an excellent deal & the hotel matched the promotion even though we were a walk in. Mind you, next day (we watched as) a couple walked in & were told that the deal was an internet only promotion, they walked out their car, collected their laptop & proceeded to book a couple of nights & saved over 50 euro. Rooms were spacious & clean.  The pool area was over run by children attending a function on the only day we chose to use. But enjoyed watching the kids having fun. Didn't eat at the hotel as there were a number of places around the area, mind there were still alot of places closed. Take advantange of some of the bars/restaurants that offer a free tapas with your drinks in the early afternoon. Enjoyed this part of Alicante& Hotel Castilla

title: Excellent Value near to huge sandy beach
review: The Castilla Alicante represents excellent value for money, with a quiet location, excellent staff and spacious rooms.  The hotel is 3-4 miles from Alicante itself, but this means its adjacent to the huge long sandy San Juan beach that sweeps up the coast for miles.  There is a large bar area and an even bigger restaurant, but both were very quiet whilst I was there (May 2011). The breakfast had a comprehensive cold buffet plus serve-yourself bacon and eggs – the orange juice tasted like it was freshly squeezed – as you’d expect given they are grown locally.  The rooms were spacious, with a large bathroom complete with bath / shower and bidet, let down only by those nasty sachets of shampoo and shower gel and rather hard towels.  The free wi-fi worked really well, which was…

title: Great food, great service, reasonably priced!
review: I have just returned from a three night stay at Hotel Castilla Alicante. It's approximately half an hour from the airport but can easily be reached by public bus which only costs about 4 Euros.  The hotel is perfectly situated out of the city centre and yet only 5 minutes from a lovely sandy beach. When you get tired of the sand, you can return to the hotel pool and 'catch the rays' on a sunlounger although the traffic noise can be a bit off-putting even though the hedge screens you from the main road!  The hotel rooms are basic but exceptionally clean, (take your own hairdryer) and my room sported a lovely balcony overlooking the sea.  Although I arrived at 12 noon, a couple of hours before my room was technically available, this was no problem to the Reception staff who were…

title: Fantastic value for your money!
review: The hotel was great - nothing special, but suitable for our needs and for fantastic money. The hotel is clean, service perfect (receptionists speak English, they're very helpfull), location is approx 100 m from see, however a little bit far from the center (10 km). Bus stop is just in front of the hotel (1,25 €), taxi is around 12 €. Rooms are good, but when the weather is cold, the air conditioning doesn't heat that well. Breakfast was fine, however it's always the same, so I recommend the hotel just for a short stay (weekend getaway, business trip, etc.).

title: "great value for money; highly recommend it for a summer location
review: Rooms are very clean and spacious. We had a lovely large balcony with some views of the sea. I would recommend this hotel for a Summer break as it is in very close proximity (right across the road) from a beautiful clean beach. However, the location for a spring break is not ideal as there is very little to do in the proximity as most shops/restaurants are closed because it is out of season. The tram and bus stop right outside the hotel and a tram journey is 20 minutes to Alicante city. However, the last tram leaves the city at 10.20pm and the last bus at 11.20pm so there is not much time to explore the nightlife in the city as taxis are approx €15. A taxi from the airport to the hotel is €40 approx. However, we took the shuttle bus to the city and then a texi to the hotel.…

title: If only all hotels were like this one.
review: If only all hotels were as good as this one, traveling to Spain would be even more delightful!  It is modestly classed as 3-Star but that does not do justice to the friendly and comfortable ambience of the hotel. There is a lovely open-plan bar cafe which has an outdoor street-side section for people watchers.  There are tasty snacks on the menu there all day. The resturant serves breakfast buffet, sit-down lunch and dinner serving from what we call a non-threatening menu; part Spanish and part northern European.  I must comment on the extremely friendly and knowlegable Receptionists who seem to know everything you want to know about!  For instance they changed out room for us last year (shower/bath requirements) on the spot and with no fuss. The rest of the staff are quietly…

title: The worst hotel we have stayed in for 40 years
review: Out of season we would not recommend this hotel to anyone. We, as the only clients on half board, were treated by an ever changing staff as an inconvenience. We were expected to eat in the hotel's public bar - the beautiful restaurant serving "international cuisine" Remain firmly shut during our 4 night stay. When we protest about eating in the bar smoking among members of the public on the first morning and supposedly having a buffet meal served by the bartender at our table, the meeting room was opened for us at each breakfast time but our dinners were always served lukewarm and of poor quality in the public bar in front of the flat screen tv.  We were advised by the receptionist the day before we were leaving to book our airport taxi in advance. She rang our room later to…

title: Decent Hotel! Good Location!
review: We have just returned from a long weekend - 3 nights. The hotel was mostly fine. We were in room 811. It was a good size, clean, comfortable, had a nice large balcony, a sea view  and in a good location to go to the beach, take the bus into town, walk to the Golf complex for a night out etc. Our only issue was an annoying mechanical/plumbing type noise that started around 8:30 every morning.... it was quiet at night.   San Juan is very Spanish and is as would be expected of the Spanish people, culture and lifestyle. There are a lot of Spanish tourists there as it is a favorite local beach, with good access to Madrid, Barcelona and Valencia. There were language difficulties, but all you need is a phrase book and they appreciate if you try and communicate in Spanish. The area is…

title: Very pleasant stay.
review: We stayed here for 5 nights for a short getaway holiday.  Large comfortable room with lots of storage space.  Nice and quiet and very close to the beach.  We didn't have a sea view but the rooms at the front did and it didn't bother us that much.  Very helpful staff at reception and the rooms were kept very clean.  Had a few language problems in the restaurant but we were in Spain and most of the guests at this hotel appeared to be Spanish so what the heck!  We will just have to brush up on our Spanish next time!

title: Amazing holiday
review: Beautiful hotel, great service, walking distance to the beach. Great variety for breakfast. Clean room every day. Beach-absolutely amazing, long , clean, safe even for my 3 years old daughter. We would appriciate swimmingpool for kids and better playground in the hotel area.

title: great value,great hotel ,quiet location
review: stayed here 22-25 november . thoroughly enjoyed our stay. hotel was spotless room excellent with a v large balcony[think ours was extra big ask for room 102 or others ending 02 these seem to be at the endof the building.]. room cleaned every day ,checked in at at 11pm at night no problems.yes there are road works, and yes there isnt much to do of an evening but transport is so cheap we went to benidorm for the day it cost 3 euros each way. ate locally first night an ok meal in argentinian restaurant. 2nd night went into town centre. i would love to think that during the summer this would be a bustling little resort, but in november its quiet. this was nt a problem for us. my 1 tip would be if you can make time catch 2 buses back to the airport the number 21 or 22 into the centre…

title: Nice  Hotel- terrible area
review: The hotel was clean and tidy, with very basic rooms  as expected for the cost. We didnt however expect our door to be opened in the middle of the night on 3 occassions!  The area isnt tourist based and english-speaking bars and restaurants are non existant in the local vacinity. The beach was nice and went on for miles. As it was October, there wernt many places open to eat, and those that were, usually opened at 8 or 9pm to cater for the locals. Overall, this could be a good place to stay in a few years time once the tram line has been finished, and the local establishments start to take on tourism a bit more as we felt like outcasts- only met 1 english family the whole time we where there!

title: Excellent for short break
review: The Castilla discreetly hides itself away amongst the neighbouring high rises that sadly extend along the whole length of the otherwise lovely, wide and expansive St Juan beach.  Its seven or so storeys make it comparatively small and inconspicuous in its company, and the signage doesn't help, consisting of just one understated indication bizarrely on the side facing away from the town of Alicante.  If you don't know exactly where you are, you could very easily pass it by, so take a taxi from the airport (about 30 Euros), and try later to remember where it is!  The neighbourhood is largely residential and Spanish-speaking, with few other hotels nearby, but there are plenty of bars, restaurants and supermarkets within a hundred yards or so.  Several were already closed, though,…

title: Poor Hotel and even worse location
review: We were meant to stay in this hotel for 5 nights (24th - 29th Oct) but only managed to last 3 nights! The hotel can only be compared to a 1960s hospital and the location is very poor. The resort is run down and deserted at this time of year. No decent bars/ places to eat and locals were very rude.   Hotel was very basic and on several occassions people walked into our room (despite it being locked!). Poor was also locked alday, even when it was 25C outside.  We decided to cut our losses and come home 2 nights early, dont go!

title: Nice Hotel, Poor Area
review: The Castilla Alicante Hotel is very clean and the staff were helpful and friendly and the breakfast more than adequate.  San Juan beach was very quiet and a bit rundown.  Not sure if this is because it was out of season and maybe some restaurants/bars have closed now.

title: Great Hotel
review: We stayed at the Hotel Castilla Alicante for a week in May 2008.  Hotel We got a taxi to the hotel from the airport ( 32 Euros) which took about 20 minutes. There are plenty of taxis waiting for you to use. Our room had a large balcony overlooking the sea & the room was very clean & spacious ( maid came in to clean everyday).  The hotel is situated about a 1 minute walk from Playa San Juan beach, which is a fabulous sandy beach about 6 miles long. The beach has European Blue flag status and it is easy to see why. Food We found that there weren't many English speaking waiters in this resort so if you don't speak Spainish you will have to point a lot! However if you are struggling there are a few more English speaking restaurants in El Campello & Alicante. Good restaurants we…

title: Good value
review: Castilla hotel   date sept 14-30 2007 Steve and Lyn  Oxfordshire England  We have just returned from 16 nights at the castilla alicante. The rooms were very clean and the maid service was excellent Daily towel changes etc. We stayed on the sixth floor and Had a side sea view across the road  past a couple of high rises.The hotel is in a residential area so do not expect pretty sea views etc, however the balconys are fairly large and do benefit from the sun most of the day. The beautiful 7 km long san juan beach is only 3 mins walk from the hotel and the 21 bus (stop outside hotel) will take you to ALICANTE or EL CAMPELLO for 1 euro. The nearest Tram station is COSTA BLANCA (left out of hotel and 600 mtrs along the av de costa blanca) The fair again 1  euro and connections to…

title: great location for quiet spanish beach holiday
review: we spent 6 nights in this modern, clean and friendly hotel, it is located near the beach and casual eating and drinking institutions. A knowledge of spanish is useful as there is little english spoken, the hotel bar provides adequate snacks for late breakfast and lunch and has a nice balcony for people watching

title: Clean, welcoming hotel close to beach
review: Great location, about 200m from the beautiful San Juan beach, a few yards to bus stops for getting into Alicante and within 2 mins' walk of several small local restaurants and shops. We stayed with a toddler and a baby and the hotel staff were all friendly and helpful over everything from broken glass on the floor (the toddler.....) to teaching a few useful words in Spanish.  Rooms, as has been said by others, were extremely clean, spacious, had sturdy furnishings (perhaps not the latest fashion but in excellent order, no scratches, missing screws or stains here) and were cleaned daily while we were at breakfast. The marble/granite floors and low railings on the balcony were not ideal for young children but I imagine most hotels round here would be similar and we had extra…

title: Fabulous Find
review: We took a gamble to book this hotel but what a find!  Lovely clean, tidy, spacious.  Breakfast was lovely, best coffee I have tried!  Hotel reception spoke good english and was helpful.  Rooms lovely, nice balcony to enjoy sunset.  Located in residential part Alicante, which meant it was quite at night.  2 mins from gorgeous beach.  Pool was deserted during the day, again fabulous.  Huge supermarket, bars, restaurants etc 5 mins walk away.  Ideal location for a quite and peaceful hotel.  Got taxi from airport 15 euros, but if you have time, get bus from outside airport (E6) to Alicante marina, then bus (21 or 22) to directly outside Hotel.  Total journey costs 4 euros.  Bargain and you sightsee as well.  We looked at other hotels but this one was much more value for money.  Book…

title: Clean, friendly and modern
review: The Castilla is excellent value for money if you're looking for a convenient, clean and modern hotel with friendy and efficient staff. We got a late deal and lthough it was slightly out of the centre of 'shopping' in alicante, the bus service was frequent and reliable and cost less than 1 euro to get into the marina and main shopping area hosting stores such as Zara and Mango. If you want a quiet, clean hotel, on the outskirts of the centre then Castilla is ideal. Be careful with Taxi's from the Airport, we got stung with nearly 40 euros but it should cost 25 max.

title: Clean and Spacious
review: This hotel is actually in San Juan Playa, not Alicante, so we were constantly taking taxis everywhere. It's only  2-3 minutes to the beach, which is nice to walk on at sunset, but during the day you have to pay for absolutely everything. 3 euros to sit under an umbrella!  The rooms were big and clean, with an outdoor deck with a table and chairs. The beds were really comfortable, too.   Lots of tourists stay here, and one night there were some really loud (possibly drunk) people in the room next to ours. I went downstairs and complained to the staff, who were very helpful and called them to tell them to quiet down.   The only bad thing about this place is the restaurant. For 12 euros you get stale plain breadsticks and plain, greasy food. Good food is very hard to come by in…

title: Nice hotel - good base to explore Alicante province
review: We chose the Hotel Castilla Alicante for a one week end of winter break. The hotel is set one block back from the Sant Joan seafront. There is a regular bus service into the centre of Alicante with the bus stop a couple of minutes along the street outside the hotel.   We were taken aback when we arrived to find ourselves in a world of high rise apartment blocks, most of which appeared to be uninhabited at this time of year. There was also a lot of refurbishment work going on. Having said that, we did find a local community around the hotel. There are shops selling fruit and vegetables, newsagents, banks etc. The people we met were quite nice, and it certainly helps if you can speak Spanish. The best local restaurant was the Rincon Alicantino, serving quality local fare in a…

title: Good Hotel, Excellent Beach
review: We have stayed at Hotel Castilla Alicante a couple of times.  The hotel is above average, with nice rooms and decent service. The breakfast is OK (for Spain), and you can eat pretty well in the cafe attached to the hotel. There is a fair size pool, with a small seating area. However, the real attraction of the hotel for us is the excellent San Juan beach, which is less than a 5 minute walk away.  There is a reasonable selection of restaurants in San Juan. Bizarrely, many of the restuarants will not serve you coffee after your meal in the high season (as they are so busy), which I have never encountered before. Alicante is a 15 minute bus ride away if you feel the need to shop or eat somewhere a bit more adventurous.   Recommended - although be warned, this is predominantly a…

title: very nice
review: I like this hotel located in San Juan around 8 KM from alicante center.  If you don't have a car to go in alicante center , the bus stop is one street at front the hotel.The staffs is nice , food are fine.
